intro: Isoplesion pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Isoplesion pyrenaicum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
